channel.title: CEC | Composer
channel.description: Website for the composer Christopher Chandler.

item.title: New Website
item.description: Welcome to my new site! I’ve created a brand new website using Jekyll and GitHub Pages, and I am in the process of transferring everything from the old sites, so please pardon the dust.

item.title: Second Prize in ASCAP/SEAMUS Commission Competition
item.description: I had a great week at Lawrence University for SEAMUS! I was able to hear some new music, catch up with old friends, and make some new ones. The trip was especially exciting as I was awarded Second Prize in the 2012 ASCAP/SEAMUS Student Commission Competition! Congratulations to the First Prize recipient, Eli Fieldsteel, and the other finalists Erik DeLuca and Lanier Sammons. As part of the award, SEAMUS has commissioned me to write a new work of my own choosing for the 2013 conference at McNally Smith College of Music in St. Paul, Minnesota.

item.title: 2012 ASCAP/SEAMUS Commission Finalist
item.description: I am thrilled that the resonance after… has been nominated as one of four finalists for the 2012 ASCAP/SEAMUS Student Composer Commission Competition! The piece will be performed at the upcoming 2012 SEAMUS Conference and Festival at Lawrence University, where the first and second prize winners will be announced.

item.title: Cleveland Chamber Symphony
item.description: A chamber orchestra version of my Master’s thesis Shifts will be performed on the Cleveland Chamber Symphony’s Young and Emerging Composer’s Concert. The concert will take place at 7:30pm on May 9, 2011 in Glick Recital Hall at the Music School Settlement in Cleveland, OH.

item.title: First Prize in OFMC Contest
item.description: Quartet for alto flute, bass clarinet, harp, and piano has been awarded First Prize in the Ohio Federation of Music Clubs annual composition contest.

item.title: Eastman School of Music
item.description: I am very excited to announce that I will be moving to Rochester, NY to begin my doctorate in composition at the Eastman School of Music in the fall of 2011!

item.title: AME 2009 Composition Competition
item.description: the resonance after… has been named as the winner of the American Modern Ensemble’s Fifth Annual Composition Competition. AME is a new music ensemble based in New York City and directed by composer Robert Paterson. The piece will be performed by AME on their upcoming Pieces of Eight concert on December 13th.

item.title: SCI/ASCAP Commission Competition Regional Finalist
item.description: the resonance after… has been selected as one of two finalists for Region V East in the 2010 SCI/ASCAP Commission Competition. The piece now moves on to the national level among 18 total scores competing for a $1500 commission and a $1000 commission.

item.title: Accent10 Summer Festival
item.description: Excited to be attending the Accent10 summer music festival held at the University of Cincinnati’s College-Conservatory of Music where I’ll work with composer Ricardo Zohn-Muldoon and have a performance of the resonance after….

item.title: Midwest Graduate Music Consortium New Music Concert
item.description: the resonance after… has been selected for performance at the Midwest Graduate Music Consortium 2010 Conference at the University of Chicago. The University of Chicago New Music Ensemble will perform the piece under the direction of Barbara Schubert on Saturday, April 17 as part of the new music concert at 7:30pm.
